poem:
Title: A Life Unfurled

In the harsh cradle of Batley, she grows,
From council flat to town hall's daunting rows.
First to taste learning's tempting fare,
First to tread the stage's bare.
She sees culture's power and knows,
It lifts lives, above our woes.
Through art's spell, she sows the seeds,
Of dreams, of jobs, of fulfilling needs.
